section.para: Users of the commercial editions of xTuple ERP are required to enter a license key to verify their registration of the software. This requirement does not apply to users of the PostBooks edition. To register your commercial installation, select the "Registration" option. The following screen will appear:
When registering your commercial installation, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the license key you received from xTuple—or from your authorized xTuple solution provider. Once a valid license key has been entered, the following information will be displayed:
Displays the name of your company.
Displays the date when your registration expires. Expired license keys can be renewed for another term either by contacting xTuple or your authorized xTuple solution provider.

Displays the maximum number of concurrent xTuple client connections you are licensed to have, as per the terms of your xTuple license agreement. Included in this total are concurrent connections made from xTuple ERP, xTuple Connect, and/or any other xTuple-branded client software. If you are exceeding your maximum number of licensed users, you should arrange to purchase more licenses either by contacting xTuple or your authorized xTuple solution provider. For non-xTuple client connections (e.g., pgAdmin, web interfaces, etc.), you are allowed up to double your number of licensed users. For example, if you have 10 licensed users, then you would be allowed up to 20 non-xTuple client connections. Additional external connections are allowed for sites where the xTuple Web Portal is installed. To get an accurate view of all your current connections, use the following menu path from the graphical xTuple Desktop: Window > Desktop > Users Online.
